meanings.definition: Komondors: a breed of large Hungarian sheepdog with a long, corded coat.
meanings.sent1: The komondors guarded the sheep with their impressive size and unique coat.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of komondors at the dog park, and they were so fluffy!
meanings.sent3: The komondors decided to have a fashion show to show off their stylish corded coats.
meanings.sent4: The komondors' coats were like a curtain of ropes, flowing as they ran through the field.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the majestic komondors left a lasting impression on everyone who saw them.

meanings.definition: Komondors: plural form of komondor, referring to more than one dog of this breed.
meanings.sent1: We visited a farm where several komondors roamed freely, protecting the livestock.
meanings.sent2: The komondors' loyalty to their owners is unmatched by any other breed.
meanings.sent3: The komondors held a meeting to discuss the best way to guard the farm from intruders.
meanings.sent4: The presence of the komondors was a reassuring presence for the sheep in the pasture.
meanings.sent5: The farmer relied on the komondors to keep the predators away from the flock.
